data.title: Who Was Frederick the Great?
data.meta_description: A ruler born in the 18th century, Frederick lived in an age where the world was ruled by despots, but if there ever was a man who personified what the term Enlightened Absolutism meant, it was…
data.text:
Prussia’s greatest King

A ruler born in the 18th century, Frederick lived in an age where the world was ruled by despots, but if there ever was a man who personified what the term Enlightened Absolutism meant, it was Frederick II of Prussia.

To start this article, I will describe the term enlightened absolutism.

In 2023, a good chunk of the globe’s population live in democracies. In short, this means that the people are the people who vote into office their leaders, who are responsible to them, and regularly have to stand in front of the electorate to maintain their positions.

To stop one man from acquiring too much power, power is divided between different branches; the executive, legislative, and judiciary.

It’s not a bulletproof system by any means, but it’s the best with which humanity has come up yet.

Contrary to this scheme, in an absolutist system, power( executive, legislative, and at some places even judiciary) was concentrated in the hands of an absolute ruler, usually holding the title King.

Absolutism emerged in Europe during the 17th century, while following the spread of the ideas of the Enlightenment in the 18th century, absolutism entered its enlightened phase, with the rulers adopting the motto of everything for the people…
